segment.source: How to Create a Time Limited Recovery Image
segment.target: How to Create a Time Limited Recovery Image

segment.source: How to Create a Time Limited Recovery Image
segment.target: How to Create a Time Limited Recovery Image

segment.source: How to Create a Time Limited Recovery Image
segment.target: How to Create a Time Limited Recovery Image

segment.source: You can create a DaRT recovery image that can only be used for a certain number of days after it is generated.
segment.target: You can create a DaRT recovery image that can only be used for a certain number of days after it is generated.

segment.source: To do this, you must run the DaRT Recovery Image Wizard at a command prompt and specify the number of days.
segment.target: To do this, you must run the DaRT Recovery Image Wizard at a command prompt and specify the number of days.

segment.source: To create a recovery image that has a time limit
segment.target: To create a recovery image that has a time limit

segment.source: Open a Command Prompt with administrator credentials.
segment.target: Open a Command Prompt with administrator credentials.

segment.source: Change the directory to the location of the ERDC.exe program.
segment.target: Change the directory to the location of the ERDC.exe program.

segment.source: Using the following syntax, run the DaRT Recovery Image Wizard.
segment.target: Using the following syntax, run the DaRT Recovery Image Wizard.

segment.source: NumberOfDays is a positive integer that represents the number of days that the DaRT recovery image will be usable.
segment.target: NumberOfDays is a positive integer that represents the number of days that the DaRT recovery image will be usable.
